review: This game is the epitome of modern blizzard and their greed. Overwatch 2: the whole point of the 2 was to bring in the PvE mission game mode that let you customize your abilities to face a horde of robots. What we got was Archives+ that just made archives more flashy. IF your new to Overwatch, which i doubt most people playing this game are, Archives was a Co-Op event that added lore based missions to Overwatch and brought some semblance of a story mode to the game. The 2 was supposed to give us that story mode. What did we get? Grindy battlepass, overpriced skins, and 3 MISSIONS that are also overpriced for what they are. They couldnt even bother to give us the character select stuff from Archives like Retribution where it would be a custom character select screen. This game is a lazy cash grab, aimed at milking your wallet dry by a company that cant even treat their employees right without harassing them. Save your time, dont get this piece of shit game. I have over 1000 hours in overwatch, i played on my xbox and pc for a long time when the game first came out as origins edition on consoles. I have seen this game thrive and then quickly die and turn into a shell of its former self.

Used to play Overwatch 1, now I play Overwatch none

P.s. Fk Blizzard for being so greedy all the time
I have 1500+ hrs on this **** game unfortunately and I'm never getting that back.

Ğ¼ĞµÑ€ÑĞ° Ğ½ĞµÑ„Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ°Ñ 20 years old Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ñ‡ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğµdiamond4mmrs

Some perspective from a player that's been playing Overwatch since 2016 and over 3k hours total in the game. I was HEAVILY invested in competitive seasons 1-4 even playing on a few teams that played for real money. This game now is a far cry from what it once was in terms of what I invested a good portion of my life into back then. While the game play has remained fairly consistent and the balance of characters.....quirky.....at times, the game never felt totally unbalanced. 

While most recent reviews for this game focus on the failure to deliver the promised PvE content, to me that's just the tip of the iceberg.

My biggest issue with the game today isn't as much as the balance or gameplay loop, but the stupidly predatory monetary practices related to earning in game items. As a day one 2016 player, I have pretty much everything in the game for the characters I play already, but having new friends come into the game is depressing in terms of unlocking things. 

I remember back in the day when we all joked about loot boxes, and how it couldn't get worse, boy were we wrong. At least with the loot boxes, you got a chance to get the legendary items, and if not by chance, earning tokens from opening said boxes to buy them within a reasonable time. NOW you have to wait to spend $20 on skins during seasonal times and item shop rotations that were once FREE.

Only play this game if you wanna if you think the core game play is interesting, if you care in the slightest about cosmetics or character customization as a new player STAY AWAY.

I loved this game, and still do, and even come back from time to time to play it. But this game is like the drug addict son who's life is a shambling disaster, but every now and then does something "good". So you go to check it out only to find, that while a slight improvement, is still a total mess.

[h1] Remember when Overwatch advertised itself as, "Don't play classes, play heroes!" [/h1]

Overwatch is, and has always been a cash cow made to appeal to escapists who just want an easy skill-ceiling based, flashy game, and to bad players who rage quit at tf2.
 
The game has so many restrictions on skill curve development, and single player gameplay that it forces you to rely off being around your team; And since your abilities come back passively, and rapidly, making it more so ability reliant, then what reflex is there? TF2 is a semi reflex shooter sure, but even then its all about your movement control, and aim. Strong abilities take effort to charge; The few that're passive, Mad Milk/Gas Passer, don't instantly give you a powerful boost for a kill just cuz its ready. You can't even main a character without OW telling you to stop getting good at it.

Overwatch doesn't complicate knowledge so all you have to do is press a button for easy rewards. Try teaching c-tapping to a Pharah main; Junkrat sticky jump dmg immunity go brr. Mercy can heal a player, but medic has to manage overheal. The perfect game for nihilistic players who didn't wanna grind out skill for glory, to learn to appreciate the ladder climb, who rage quit from tf2 for an easy to reward game like overwatch - or just outright start cheating. 

[b] Overwatch is quantity, over quality compared to TF2. [/b]

TF2 class Loadouts offer a wide dynamic range of gameplay styles, and even full subclass sets that vary between weapons. Such as an ambushing crit-a-cola force-a-nature scout, degreaser flare combo pyro, revengineer, battle medic, fat scout, and even further with hard subclass loadouts like demoknight, trollgier, and the legendary hoovy. Running into a class, you never know what they'll have, and some weapons can even mitigate class counters so you best be ready. You see a scout and you know he's gonna be jumpy and dodgy, but dependent on the scouts loadout, his playstyle could be dramatically different with weapons. Overwatch on the other hand would rather split dynamic gameplay styles into their own characters. Everyone has the same single sets of weapons that can't be swapped to easily know what they'll be doing. So its much easier to read, and often times solid counter. You immediately know what they're capable of, and their limits to easily exploit right off the bat. 

Meanwhile for escapist players who just want big asses, and tits. Basic 'token' characters with simple dynamics, and little to no distinct, unique personalities just to milk out more names, and sometimes more waifus, in their roster. Sometimes even just for "political inclusiveness" rather than a genuine charming design. Still makes me laugh once overwatch had on their website "don't play classes, play heroes!" Though just remember, its what's on the inside that counts. Not a flashy diamond encrusted poop. Heroes die, but more often than not they can live long enough to become the villain. Just depends on the heart of it. You ready to respawn?

tl;dr OW is a game designed for players who want an easy, and flashy game to get milked by greedy corpos just like genshrek imğŸ…±ï¸act
